comments: Professor Kim is a great professor and really cares about his students. He is very organized and clear with course material and makes sure the class is on the same page. He is really such a nice person, I recommend his classes!

tag_professor: GROUP PROJECTS (6)  Get ready to read (5)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Tough Grader (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Inspirational (1)
comments: He really puts a lot of effort into teaching, which is so refreshing, though his lectures can be a bit boring. He learns everyone\'s names. His exams are take-home and ask you to apply class concepts to real world events. He is one of the few professors that tries to make sure his students to leave the class with critical thinking and life skills.

comments: Not horrible, but not great. Really passionate at teaching international relations, but was fairly dry at points. Tests were easy, a lot of assigned reading, but I read maybe 1 or 2 chapters of the book and still managed an A.

comments: Moonhawk is a really good professors. Lectures can be a bit boring and dry, but very informative and organized. You can tell he\'s really passionate about political science, and wants students to feel the same. Tests are hard, but very manageable if you go to lecture, recitation, and read the textbook and online readings.

comments: You get out of it what you put in. Lot\'s of reading, but it\'s a Poli-Sci class so it\'s to be expected. Don\'t complain about not knowing what\'s going on if you don\'t do the readings

comments: Professor Kim\'s lectures are dull. Towards the end I stopped reading and listening a whole lot to his lectures. Exams are tough, group project was brutal, but he is organized. I like poli sci so I found the content to be somewhat interesting when I reviewed it on my own. I would take his class again only because he is clear cut about what he wants

stu_tags: GROUP PROJECTS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  GET READY TO READ
comments: Professor Kim knows what he\'s talking about and seems to enjoy teaching the course despite it being an entry-level class. He is always prepared and his lectures go over everything on the tests. The readings are somewhat dull and you could not do them and still pass. He assigns two partner papers during the semester. Overall, it\'s a very good class.

comments: Professor Kim\'s lectures could be very dry at times but he was very clear when explaining the concepts. In my opinion, the grading was a bit unfair and the tests were very difficult but I somehow ended up with an Okay grade considering.

comments: Lectures were extremely boring and broad. It seemed the professor didn\'t engage the students well. He appeared to know the topic well, but unfortunately just wasn\'t adept at teaching it in an interesting way.

tag_professor: GROUP PROJECTS (6)  Get ready to read (5)  Clear grading criteria (3)  Tough Grader (3)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Inspirational (1)
comments: Kim cares very much about you learning the material, he always makes sure he is available for questions. But his lectures are slow and not very informative, sometimes it feels like he is trying to explain concepts like we are oblivious to the topic. Tests are pretty strait forward from the material in the text.

comments: Class was boring. I was in his PSCI class and though I really liked the material, he failed to present it to his class in an interesting manner. Also, hearing him bash the Universal Declaration of Human Rights was beyond annoying and rude. Avoid his class at all means, lecture is awful but he\'s delusional and tests extremely hard.

comments: As a Poli Sci. major I found his lectures wildly boring, hard to follow due to a lack of spark I guess in his voice. You can do the reading alone and be fine if you have an interest in Poli Sci. If not, I would steer clear of him. Yawwn.

comments: Worst teacher I have ever had. His lectures were not clear and really bad. His tests were very difficult. When I was taking the test, I felt like he was trying to trick us with every question. He never asked a straight forward question. This is supposed to be international relations but the entire semester, all he talked about was America.
